description: The Assistance to Training Institutions Scheme, implemented by the Ministry of MSME, provides financial support to institutions offering entrepreneurship and skill development training. The scheme aims to enhance the employability and entrepreneurial skills of individuals, particularly in the MSME sector.
key_features: Financial aid for setting up training infrastructure
Support for conducting entrepreneurship and skill development programs

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to Rs. 1 Crore for establishing or upgrading training institutions
benefits.program_support: Funding for training programs, max Rs. 10 Lakhs per program

institution_criteria: Government institutions, NGOs, or private organizations recognized by the MSME Ministry
Must have experience in conducting training programs
program_criteria: Training programs must focus on entrepreneurship or skill development for MSMEs
Must adhere to MSME Ministry guidelines

eligible_activities: Establishment or upgradation of training infrastructure
Skill development training for MSME sectors

steps: Visit the MSME portal or scheme-specific website
Submit an online application with a detailed proposal for training activities
Upload required documents, including institutional registration and program details
Applications are evaluated by the MSME Ministry
Approved institutions receive funding in phases
application_process.note: Funding is released based on project milestones and performance

special_notes: Institutions must submit progress reports to receive subsequent funding
Training programs must align with MSME sector needs
Priority is given to institutions serving underserved regions
